byline.contributor: Artin Afkhami contributed reporting from Boston.

abstract: Iran’s top leaders say American accusation of Iranian-hatched plot to assassinate Saudi Arabia’s ambassador to Washington is designed to sow discord between Iran and Saudi Arabia; Iran's foreign minister, however, says his government is at least willing to examine evidence that United States claims it has.
snippet: Iran’s foreign minister implicitly acknowledged the possibility that the suspected plot to kill the Saudi ambassador might not be pure American fantasy.
lead_paragraph: Iran’s foreign minister implicitly acknowledged the possibility that the suspected plot to kill the Saudi ambassador might not be pure American fantasy.

headline.main: Iran Accuses U.S. of Trying to Sow Regional Discord
headline.print_headline: Iran Accuses U.S. of Trying To Sow Regional Discord
headline.seo: Iran Accuses U.S. of Sowing Discord with Murder Charges
